roleset.name: make or become weaker, making or becoming weaker
roleset.note: WEAKEN-V NOTES: Verbnet entry other_cos-45.4, other framed members include decrease, halt, narrow, shut, slow, sweeten and probably others. (from weaken.01-v)

example.name: passive
example.text: [Jaguar's own defenses against a hostile bid]-1 are weakened *trace*-1, analysts add, because fewer than 3% of its shares are owned by employees and management.
example.arg: because fewer than 3% of its shares are owned by employees and management

example.name: ergative
example.text: According to the Value Line Investment Survey, demand for Nekoosa's commodity paper has weakened, prompting earnings to decline by 6.6% in the third quarter ended Sept. 30.
example.arg: According to the Value Line Investment Survey
prompting earnings to decline by 6.6% in the third quarter ended Sept. 30

example.name: agentive/transitive
example.text: However, people familiar with the buy-out group said Mr. Pope's departure would weaken the airline's management at a critical time.

example.name: expected stock reports
example.text: John's stocks weakened dramatically from $1000 a share to less than $.50 a share.

roleset.name: lacking skill, intensity
roleset.note: WEAK-J NOTES: Updated by Julia based on BOLT-2,3 (from weak.01-j)
WEAKER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from weaker.01-j)

example.name: lexical comparative
example.text: The addiction may very well be weaker .
